author: travelandtourworld.com
title: France tourism hopeful to surpass 85 million mark in 2015Travelandtourworld.com
text:
France tourism hopeful to surpass 85 million mark in 2015 Published on : Tuesday, August 25, 2015
The world’s most visited country since the 1980s, France, is all set to welcome a record number of tourists this year, said minister for foreign affairs and tourism Laurent Fabius.
This record is likely to increase the tourism revenue by about 4 percent. Notably, tourism contributed 7 percent to the France’s economy last year bringing in 150 billion euros.
Although, the contribution of tourism to the overall economy in France looks promising, the government is concerned with the fact that visitors tend to spend less in France than elsewhere. In order to encourage more tourists spending in the country, the government has extended store opening hours and tried to improve the much maligned customer service.
Despite boasting of some of the best tourist spots in the world, the infamous French surliness poses a major stumbling block on the road to tourism victory.
Infact, the TripAdvisor website frequently votes Paris the rudest city in Europe.
Inspite of all these hurdles, the Tourism Minister is hopeful that the number of tourists will surpass 85 million this year with an increase in foreign tourist spending.
